alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 2:45PM EDT until July 12 at 5:09AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Vermont... Winooski River At Waterbury affecting Washington County. For the Winooski River...including Moretown, Montpelier, Waterbury, Essex Junction...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Winooski River at Waterbury. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 417.0 feet, The Winooski from Waterbury downstream through Richmond will be at bankful. Some minor flooding of low lying fields will occur. At 419.0 feet, Water will flood fields behind the Vermont State Office Complex in Waterbury. Field flooding will occur from Waterbury downstream through Richmond. At 421.0 feet, Water will approach low lying parking lots at the Waterbury State Office complex, and Rowe Field in Waterbury will flood. Downstream in Richmond, Bridge Street at the Winooski bridge near the Round Church will be inundated, and the Richmond public park will flood. The river will be out of its banks from Waterbury downstream through Richmond, with considerable field flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 421.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 419.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM EDT Monday was 421.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 424.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 419.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 423.3 feet on 05/27/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 245 AM EDT.
